children.subject: Probably not too helpful for this question, but many times at hackathons Amazon gives promo codes for $100 AWS credit. Maybe you can get those somehow.
https://www.floydhub.com/ gives 100 hours of GPU time for free

history.content:
Hi, just wondering if anyone knows of free AWS or other cloud computing services for Berkeley students? This can be through free credits or access to Berkeley's own cloud computers.

I want to learn Apache Spark in more depth by running some common algorithms on huge datasets (eg, Youtube dataset***). I'm going to download some implementation of a video processing algorithm, for example, make it work on Spark, and optimize it as much as possible.

I know Amazon has a "free" tier, but I'm not sure if it'll provide enough machines. Plus, I want to experiment with Spark on FPGAs and GPUs, but they're not included in Free Tier.


Thank you!

***https://research.google.com/youtube8m/
history.subject: Free AWS credits?
